message:
Dear Linux geeks, does anyone know what it would take for me to take over a linux distribution that will be discontinued?

Please help, it is my favourite distribution and I am literally in tears over this. I have not been this sad since someone died, in fact someone died and I was not this sad at all.

Please help.

data.message: Mohamed Samy Since it's based on Debian , I think you are not losing much. what about customizing Debian it self to match what you need ?
Mohamed Salah what do you mean the current trend? I have been using it for 6 months now, Linux for 3 years. I use forums for reference when I need help. What do you mean by the "current trend"?

Ahmed ElSebaei yes, I have downloaded netinstall and customized it, but this just takes 30 mins to install and bang! you have everything installed and configured. How do I go about creating something like that?
Ahmed ElSebaei Debian + Open box + Conky + Applications including Iceweasel with Flash player?

Mohamed Samy Yes you can achieve that by downloading debian minimal iso , then install just what you need . I have Debian minimal + XMonad + XDM + many other packages 
https://www.debian.org/CD/netinst/
Mohamed Samy Sorry I didn't notice your previous comment about netinstall
Yes, but what would it take to make it all in one iso so you can just install it as one instead of going through the whole process and configuring? How would I create a distro like that?
Mohamed Salah I basically want to know how to create  my own customized distro in an iso I candownload and just install.  you get my point?
Nothing is wrong, what I am wondering is, when Debian 8 comes, how do I create a crunchbang out of that that I can download as an iso and make availble to others?
"remastersys" now that is the first thread. So you are saying that #! was just that? Debian + tools  then remastersys to make it into an iso?  I thought there was more involved, or am I worng?

funny this  "I have been doing this for almost 7 years  now and after all the bs some folks created for me I have decided to  stop development of remastersys and it will no longer be available. The  remastersys forum sections will stay up for a very short period of time  and then will be removed. I just have no desire to put up with it  anymore for a free software project. I've had enough and will no longer  be doing anything with development."

Mohamed Salah I understand what you;re saying. Conky can be replicated. It's the scripts that I will need to download that do the configuring and the sources.list and i guess other stuff I don't know. It was just so much easier when other people did that for me. I asked the owner, and he said that they are discussing on how to move forward on the forums. For instance, on thing I would love to add to the world in an EMACS with the proper configuration for a Python dev environement with auto completion and a dark theme that you can just download and it works. EMACS has been very difficult for me, and I see I need to learn a lot to master it :)
Thanks guys, I like the info you shared and this I guess is enough to get me started :) I appreciate your help and support

Mohamed Salah my scond best choice is LMDE, I feel so much better with Debian as opposed to Ubuntu. But still #! boots with 150 mb ram, that's what made me crazy about it :) I like cinnamon UI, but when I got used to the dark theme and small footprint, I was hooked.
